targets.query:
SELECT sum(value)
FROM (
  SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("gauge"), 1s) AS value
  FROM "source_count"
  WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
  GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId, slot
)
GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId

SELECT sum(value)
FROM (
  SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("gauge"), 1s) AS value
  FROM "end_count"
  WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
  GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId, slot
)
GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId

SELECT sum(value)
FROM (
  SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("gauge"), 1s) AS value
  FROM "dead_end_count"
  WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
  GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId, slot
)
GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId

SELECT sum(value)
FROM (
  SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("gauge"), 1s) AS value
  FROM "error_instantRateByNode_count"
  WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
  GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId, slot
)
GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, nodeId

panels.description:
IMPORTANT. 
This metric does NOT show the overall lag on Kafka source; a largest lag among all the source partitions is shown.

targets.query: SELECT max("gauge") FROM "records_lag_max" WHERE "host" =~ /$hosts$/ AND "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "scenario" fill(none)

panels.title: Max lag among Kafka source partitions (events)

targets.query: SELECT min("min") FROM "eventtimedelay_histogram" WHERE "host" =~ /$hosts$/ AND "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "scenario" fill(null)
SELECT mean("0.5") FROM "eventtimedelay_histogram" WHERE "host" =~ /$hosts$/ AND "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "scenario" fill(null)
SELECT max("max") FROM "eventtimedelay_histogram" WHERE "host" =~ /$hosts$/ AND "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "scenario" fill(null)
SELECT min("gauge") FROM "eventtimedelay_histogram" WHERE "host" =~ /$hosts$/ AND "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "scenario" fill(null)
SELECT max("0.5") FROM "service_OK_histogram" WHERE "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND "env" =~ /^$env$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "serviceName" fill(null)
SELECT max("0.99") FROM "service_OK_histogram" WHERE "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND "env" =~ /^$env$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "serviceName" fill(null)

SELECT sum(mean)
FROM (
  SELECT mean(gauge)
  FROM "service_OK_instantRate"
  WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
  GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, serviceName, slot
)
GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, serviceName
SELECT max("0.5") FROM "service_FAIL_histogram" WHERE "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND "env" =~ /^$env$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "serviceName" fill(null)
SELECT max("0.99") FROM "service_FAIL_histogram" WHERE "scenario" =~ /$scenarioName$/ AND "env" =~ /^$env$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "serviceName" fill(null)

SELECT sum(mean)
FROM (
  SELECT mean(gauge)
  FROM "service_FAIL_instantRate"
  WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
  GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, serviceName, slot
)
GROUP BY time($__interval), scenario, serviceName

panels.description: Estimates of RocksDB state size. Aggregates (such as session windows) can have many internal states, which are reported separately.

targets.query:
SELECT sum("value")
FROM (
   SELECT mean("gauge") AS "value"
   FROM /^.*.cur_size_all_mem_tables/ 
   WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter 
   GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "operator_name", "slot"
) GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "operator_name" fill(linear)

panels.title: RocksDB cur-size-all-mem-tables

panels.description: Estimates of RocksDB state size. Aggregates (such as session windows) can have many internal states, which are reported separately.

targets.query:
SELECT sum("value")
FROM (
   SELECT mean("gauge") AS "value"
   FROM /^.*.estimate_live_data_size/ 
   WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter
   GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "operator_name", "slot"
) GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "operator_name" fill(linear)

panels.title: RocksDB estimate-live-data-size

panels.description: Estimates on number of keys in RocksDB state. Aggregates (e.g. session windows) can have many internal states. Please remember that this is only estimate, based on internal RocksDB metrics

targets.query:
SELECT sum("value")
FROM (
   SELECT mean("gauge") AS "value"
   FROM /^.*.estimate_num_keys/ 
   WHERE scenario =~ /^$scenarioName$/ AND env = '$env' AND $timeFilter 
   GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "operator_name", "slot"
) GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario", "operator_name" fill(linear)

panels.title: RocksDB estimate-num-keys

list.name: scenarioName
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "source_instantRate" WITH KEY = "scenario"

list.name: env
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "source_instantRate" WITH KEY = "env"
